result.execSummary:
The defendant Bernard G Rehor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Court has set a Probation Review Hearing for 4/10/17 at 3:00 PM.

miscConds.notes: $250 fine plus costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordererd by the Dept. of Corrections.
To reimburse the Door/Kewaunee Drug Task Force for buy money.
Maintain full-time employment as determined by Dept. of Corrections.
Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

timeConds.notes: 60 days stayed. To be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. Sentence can be served in Kewaunee County. Defendant is responsible for notifying the Door County Jail if sentence is being served in a different county.  Huber release granted. 60 days to report.
To perform 50 hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bernard G Rehor

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Bernard G Rehor in court, in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent Kristina Konop appears by phone. Court reviews events in file, reviews memo from Agent Konop. Court questions Agent Konop on community service hours defendant has completed. Agent Konop indicates defendant hasn't completed any of the community service hours that she knows of nor has he paid anything toward his financial obligations. Defendant indicates he has back issues and hasn't been working, advises he's currently working toward getting on disability. Court indicates to defendant that he needs to get community service hours done. Court won't set another hearing, probation can request hearing if she feels one is needed.
of conviction - court imposes 60 days conditional jail time.
from DOC Agent Kristina Konop re: her request for court to impose 60 days conditional jail time.
Probation review hearing on April 10, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Emails between Lt. Sternard and Judge Ehlers where as court rescinds defendants medical furlough.
DC Jail Request for Sentence Modification - Defendant requests furlough for doctor appt. on 8/05/16. Court grants request.
DC Jail request for sentence modification - defendant requests furlough for medical issues. Court grants request.
Door County Jail - Request for Sentence Modification. Defendant requests furlough for medical procedure. Court grants request.

Defendant Bernard G Rehor in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. State/Defense ready to proeed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: for DNA Sample

Defendant Bernard G Rehor in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Joan Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea on Ct. 2. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 2. Court dismisses Ct. 1 but reads in for sentencing.    Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties.  Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge. Defense asks court to set off sentencing for about 30 day. Bond remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Bernard G Rehor in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers indicates State has made a global offer to resolve all matters, asks court to set a plea/sentencing date. Bond remains in effect.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Bernard G Rehor in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerber indicates matter is close to resolving, requests a status on 2/15/16 at 10:00 am when defendant will be in court on another matter. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Defendant in custody.

Defendant Bernard G Rehor appears by video conference along with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Defendant Bernard G Rehor in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, questions defendant on missed court appearance. Atty Gerbers indicates defendant contacted him around noon yesterday regarding missed court appearance. Defendant was dealing with a non working subpump at his house. Court cancels bench warrant. State indicates there have been multiple warrants in these files, defendant was advised of todays court date when in court last time. Atty Gerbers gives argument on bond, asks court to reinstate previous bond set. Court expresses their concern regarding non appearances in the past, sets $350 cash bond in file 15-CT-20. Court reinstates $2,500 signature bond in 15-CF-72. Same conditions apply in each file.  Status conference scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Eric Maciolek in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case at 11:06 am, reviews events in file.  Atty Maciolek unsure of defendants whereabout, did try calling him but did not get a hold of him. State requests bench warrant. Court orders bench warrant.

Defendant Bernard G Rehor in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers indicates defendant has new charges in Kewaunee County, would like to see where that case is going before proceeding with these cases. State has no objection to adjournment. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerber indicates defendant is at hospital where his girlfriend is delivering their baby. Court reschedules.  Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 11:15 am.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Atty Gerbers requests a status in 45 days. Bond remains as is.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Bernard G Rehor in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.   Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted 6/29/15 by jail staff. (fingerprint card destroyed 4/20/16)
Defense Discovery Demand
Audio/Video Supplementary Discovery Demand
Status conference at 08-24-2015 09:45 am

To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center. Not to discuss case with D.R.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.

Defendant Bernard G Rehor in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 09:45 am.
